title: Should Christians Try to Convert People of Other Religions? // Biblical discussion + practical tips
description:
Should Christians proselytize, trying to convert people from one faith system to Christianity? If you asked American culture at large, the answer would be no. According to Barna Research Group, even if you asked practicing Christians, specifically Millennials, the answer still might be no. Among Practicing Millennial Christians, nearly half think it is wrong to share your faith with people of other religions with the goal of converting them, even though this same group overwhelmingly believes that accepting Jesus is the best thing that could happen in someone's life. So what are we supposed to make of this dissonance? 

Even though it may be unpopular, Christians must recognize that the Bible leaves little room for Universalism, and because of that, it's no surprise that Christians are clearly called to convert people of other religions. It's uncomfortable, I know. However, if we are to follow Jesus fully and faithfully, we must recognize that we need to share the Gospel with people who believe differently than us. 

Verses Referenced:
Matthew 28:19-20
John 14:6

title: Your Idea of the Good Life Shapes You // Thoughts on "You Are What You Love" by James K.A. Smith
description:
What is your vision of the good life? Whether you realize it or not, what you desire and what you see as "the good life" can have tremendous impact on your life. Ultimately our hearts will gravitate towards this vision of the good life, and as our hearts go, so goes our actions. What we see as the good life will ultimately become what we worship, and as Christians we must guard our hearts from being given over to inferior desires and visions of thriving. It is only when we reorient our hearts to desire God that we can begin to truly worship him.

title: You Can't Lose When Sharing Your Faith (unless you're a jerk)
description:
None of us like being rejected, and when it comes to sharing our faith, this is what most of us fear. What if I told you that when it comes to evangelism you can't lose? When you share your faith three things could happen: they could accept Christ (win!), you could plant a seed (win!), or you could get rejected (win!). Wait, rejection as a win? Yes! In this video we explore how even when you're rejected sharing your faith, you are blessed by God because he blesses those who are hated and insulted because of him. You really can't lose! Well, unless you're a jerk, but we'll talk about that at the end. 

You see, we live in a time when far too many Christians (preaching to myself here) are content to stay in our comfort zone, drawing a very small radius of faith around us. This isn't how it should be! We should be boldly sharing our faith, spreading the good news, and bringing people to Christ. This series, Real Talk About Evangelism, is all about equipping and inspiring you to live a bold life for Jesus.

title: Don't Put Jesus First...
description:
Putting Jesus first might sound like a good idea, but in reality, it implies that there are a hierarchy of things to do, some excluding Jesus. Rather putting Jesus first we should strive to put Jesus at the center of our lives. As Christians, we are new creations, and we are called to live out of this new, fully transformed identity. Everything we do, big or small, should be impacted by who we are in Christ and done in recognition of the fact that Jesus is all around us, inside of us, and empowering us. The truth is, we can do nothing apart from Jesus, and everything we do should be done for the glory of God. There is no task too small or ordinary that can't be done to bring glory to God if we are abiding in him as we are instructed to do in John 15. To abide in Jesus is to recognize his proximity to you, his all encompassing nature, his supremacy, and so much more. My challenge to you is to not see your life and your to-do list divided into "spiritual" and "ordinary" but to do everything for the glory of God, with him at the center.

title: Evangelism: What it is and Why It Matters
description:
Chances are you've heard about "evangelism" and maybe you already have some opinions on it, but what is it after all, and why does it matter? In our second installment in the "Real Talk About Evangelism" series, we're exploring what evangelism is, and why it matters. In this video I challenge you to see evangelism as the natural outflow of a love of God, or put this way, the Great Commission is the natural consequence of the Great Commandments. Jesus commands us to go into all the world to make disciples because that's what you do when you love God and love people. Evangelism matters because people matter, and it's a matter of life or death, and evangelism is the call of all Christians - it's not optional.

title: Preach the Gospel, Die, and Be Forgotten // A Modest Critique of Celebrity Pastor Culture
description:
Are you living to bring glory to your name, or to God's? Today I see more and more that people fall into the danger of seeing the church as a platform and Christianity as a means to grow their influence, brand, etc. and while it might not always be a conscious realization, it is a dangerous road to travel down as we seek the glory that God alone deserves. In this video we explore an incredibly powerful quote by Count Nikolaus von Zinzendorf who said "Preach the Gospel, die, and be forgotten." This quote, while it might not make you feel light and fluffy, should inspire you to examine your true motivations, and forces you to ask yourself, if no one took note of what I was doing for God, would I still do it?

title: Would You Be a Christian Even if Heaven Didn't Exist?
description:
Christianity without heaven? Would you still follow Jesus if heaven didn't exist? While it may seem like an odd question, it's one worth exploring because your answer will reveal your primary motivation for following Jesus. Is being a Christian just about going to heaven, or is it about something more than that? In this video I challenge you that there are three primary motivations for following Jesus: Bribery (I'm just in it for what I get out of it), Fear (I'm just in it to avoid punishment), and Love (I'm in this because I think it is worthy of my devotion). If you as a Christian are motivated by fear or by external rewards (bribery), you are going to struggle to experience authentic character growth and development. However, if you are motivated out of a love of God and a love of God's will, you will find yourself growing in your faith much faster and more effectively.

title: Should Religion and Politics Mix? The Biblical Relationship Between Religion and Politics
description:
Religion and Politics often mix as well as mentos and coke, matches and dynamite, oil and water... you get the point. However, is this how it has to be? How should Christians approach politics? This video is all about how our faith as Christians should impact our political views, if at all. You see as Christians, we don't see our faith as one part of our life, but rather as something that transforms us holistically into a new creation, so it's only natural that our faith affects all areas of our life including politics. In this video we explore three main ideas: 
1) How our faith should impact our politics
2) Jesus saves, not politics
3) Remember your citizenship is ultimately in heaven

By looking at verses like Romans 12:1, Romans 12:2, Colossians 3:2, Hebrews 12:2, 1 Corinthians 10:31, and Philippians 3:20 we get an overarching view of what the Bible has to say about this topic.

title: You Are Enough // Rough Draft Poems 002
description:
There is perhaps no greater asset someone can have than a secure sense of value. It is out of our striving for a sense that we are enough, that we matter, that we have value that we run in circles and constantly try to do more and be better just to feel like we are enough. We spend day after day and year after year trying to convince ourselves and others that we are worthy of love, and that we are enough. Yet for many of us, this hunger proves to be insatiable. No matter how hard we try, we never feel like we're quite good enough. It's no wonder that insecurity seems to be pervasive in our society because we're constantly trying to find our value in things that were never meant to hold that weight. The only source of value that will ever satisfy our souls is found in the unconditional love of God for us. It is only in the love of a perfectly heavenly Father that we can find what we've always been searching for: the true knowledge that we are ok, that we are worthy of love just as we are, that we matter, that we are enough. When we have found our sense of security, our sense of value, we no longer need to live our lives searching for the approval of others, and for the first time we can focus on simply being who we were created to be and doing what we were created to do. 

About Rough Draft Poems:
Rough draft poems is a series dedicated to putting out poems that aren't perfect, but they are honest and raw. They're rough drafts, just like you and just like me. While they may not all be autobiographical, they are all deeply felt.

description:

Wandering - Be Still the Earth

Poem Transcript:
To all the people who sat in church parking lots
trying to muster up the courage to go in
but ended up turning around,
You are welcome here.

To the girl who gave up on God 
after being told her abortion at 15
destined her to eternal damnation,
You are welcome here.

To the guy who just traded his orange jumpsuit in 
for street clothes after fifteen years behind bars,
You are welcome here.

Calling all outcasts,
rejects,
too-far-gone's,
sinners, 
and fallen saints.
You are welcome here,
but check your fake smiles at the door
bring your worries, pain, and hopes,
bring your tattered clothes and track-marked arms. 
We've got room for your suitcases full of baggage
at the cross of Christ
because he's calling out to all those who are weary and burdened
to find rest.
Rest from the rest of your story that haunts you
an opportunity to rewrite your failures into stepping stones
on your path to glory
but your real ID is required at the gate.
No polished stories,
no airbrushed smiles
covering up the pain inside
but you are welcome here
not the you you pretend to be
but the you you've long since locked away inside.
Come out
come out from hiding
and into the light
the light of love
love that knows no bounds
that has never seen a case
exempt from the power of grace
so come and take your seat
we've prepared a place
just for you.
You are welcome here.

title: Why I Chose Moody Bible Institute
description:
Picking a college is a big decision, so what made me decide to go to Moody Bible Institute? In this video I talk about a few of the reasons why I chose to attend Moody Bible Institute in Chicago, Illinois. title: Where (Some) Christians Go Wrong When It Comes to Abortion
description:
Abortion is an extremely emotionally charged issue, and this video is not about picking sides. However, among passionate pro-life Christians, I sometimes see people who fight so zealously for the unborn child, while neglecting the terrified mother, or worse yet, villainizing those that disagree with them or have had abortions in the past. This video is here to say, if you're going to be pro-life, and I think that's great, make sure to be pro-life not just for the unborn child, but for the mother as well. Let's make sure that our passion doesn't carry us away and allow us to miss the point of this all, which is to show love to all those involved.

title: Dear Guys: You Are Enough
description:
We all desire, perhaps more than anything, to know that we are enough. Insecurity is not a girl's issue, it's a people issue, and guys just as much as anyone crave to feel that they are enough, just as they are. However, for many of us, there's a nagging feeling that we're not okay just as we are, so we are forced to put on masks, try harder, do more, compare, and much more, all in an attempt to try to make ourselves feel as though we are enough. The truth is, our value shouldn't come from any source other than the unconditional love of God for us. 

All throughout this "Dear Guys" series, we've been talking about issues that we as guys need to own up to and overcome so that we can move towards the brighter future that we all want, and if we are to create that future, we'll need to do it uninhibited from our insecurities, running our race, not trying to beat everyone else at theirs. If you're a guy struggling with the haunting question of whether you're enough, this video is for you.

title: The Best Christian Advice I've Ever Received // Three Words to Change Your Life
description:
Die to Yourself. This is quite possibly the best Christian advice I've ever received, and if you start living by this concept, I think it could change your entire life. All throughout the New Testament this idea can be found, and what we're left with is the knowledge that a life well-lived is marked by a mindset of "you first not me." Dying to yourself means that you're putting the needs of others above your own selfish desires. Dying to yourself means that you live as a new creation, putting off your old self. It is in dying to yourself that we find the abundant life that Jesus set out for us, a life of purpose, passion, and meaning that is more fulfilling than anything else. Wondering how to be more selfless? How to put off your old self? How to be more like Jesus? This video is for you.

title: How to Be a Better Listener // Adopting Curiosity Over Criticism
description:
When it comes to engaging with people we disagree with, we all have a tendency to be pretty bad listeners. Our first step is often to begin criticizing others and thinking of our response before someone is even done speaking. However, if we want to become better listeners and get better at engaging with people who are different than us, we need to adopt a mindset of curiosity over criticism. When you meet someone who you don't understand, what if you saw it as an opportunity to be curious and learn, rather than being critical and divisive? 

This content comes from a message given to high school students at FCF Church in a series called Love Across the Lines: Engaging with People Who Are Different than You. If you'd like to catch this clip in context, be sure to check out the full message. 

Whether you identify as a Christian or not, I think we can all learn from the wisdom found in James 1:19 where we are instructed to be quick to listen, slow to speak, and slow to get angry.

title: Dear Guys: Porn is a Problem
description:
It's a $15 Billion Dollar industry that is fueled by each and every one of us when we choose to let lust win. With over 63,000 new visitors to Pornhub every minute, chances are you've found yourself caught up in porn before, are currently, or will be one day. As Christians how should we handle the giant temptation that is porn? Is porn bad? Is it ok for Christians to watch porn? How can Christians stop watching porn? Why is watching porn a sin? If you've asked these questions or similar ones, this video is for you. 

This is the second installment in our dear guys series, a series where we're calling guys to own up to and overcome problems that are facing all of us. This video isn't here to shame you about your porn problem, but it is here to remind you that you can overcome it. In this video we explore not just the fact that porn is fueling lust, but the subconscious narratives that porn causes to manifest in our minds and how porn reshapes our view of women and sex, placing unrealistic expectations on women and equating their value with their appearance and ability to sexually perform.

title: How to Engage with People Who Are Different Than You // Love Across the Lines Part 2
description:
Why can't we all just get along? We all desire a world where we all just get along, yet we seem bad at creating it. In part 2 of this series, Love Across the Lines, we're talking about practical tips on how to get better at engaging with people who are different than you. We cover the importance of getting into proximity with those we're seeking to engage with, learning to adopt curiosity over criticism as listeners, and how to speak in such a way that our words act as a preservative. I hope this message brings you hope and prompts you to step out in faith on a journey towards loving across the lines, just as Jesus did.

title: Dear Guys: Stop Blaming Girls for Your Lust Problems
description:
For far too long, the weight of responsibility when it comes to guys' struggles with lust has been placed on girls to wear longer skirts, higher shirts, and make sure their brothers in Christ don't stumble. There's nothing wrong with modesty, but there is a problem with shaming girls for what they're wearing in the name of modesty, and an even bigger problem with teaching guys that they're incapable of self-control. In an effort to promote purity, so much emphasis has been placed on modesty, and not enough emphasis placed on self-control. However, when Jesus addressed lust, he placed the responsibility where it should be, on the guys (see Matthew 5:29). If you're a guy, and you're struggling with lust, you're not alone. You're also not a victim to your feelings of lost. You can be a victor. You can overcome your struggles with lust, but it starts with owning your own growth, taking personal responsibility, and recognizing that you're in control, you're not at the mercies of what everyone around you wears. It's time to address this mistake in the purity movement and call guys to a higher standard so that the question is never again asked, "what was she wearing?" when a girl is the victim of sexual violence.

description:
Is the Bible still relevant? Does reading the Bible matter? In this episode we're talking all about why you shouldn't give up on the Bible, and why reading the Bible is still important today. This is the final episode in our series Real Talk About the Bible where we talk all about the weird and wonderful book that we as Christians believe is unlike any other book. Maybe you struggle to read the Bible, or maybe you're wondering if reading the Bible is really all that important, maybe you've been turned off by how people use the Bible, or maybe you just don't get what the big deal about the Bible is, in any case, this episode is for you. I'm going to challenge you to read the Bible on its own terms, and learn to love the Bible as it is, not as you want it to be. I hope you've enjoyed this series! I know I have.

description:

In this episode we talk about how Jesus doesn't see our doubts as something that disqualifies, but rather sees us in all our imperfection, flaws, and doubts, and says "I still choose you." title: What to Do When You Don't Feel God Like You Did Before
description:
What do you do after you've come off a "mountaintop" spiritual experience and now you just don't "feel" God the same way? Many Christians experience these spiritual highs, only to be surprised that when the conference, retreat, concert, etc. is over, the feelings fade and you don't feel God like you did before. In this video I talk about what to do on Monday morning, when you're back to life as usual, and everything seems the same as it was before. While the feelings we get from these mountaintop experiences often quickly fade, they don't have to be without impact, and we can use these experiences as a catalyst for lasting change and growth in our faith. If you want to see your faith grow and not feel like you're on a roller coaster of emotions in your faith journey, then this video is for you. In this video I give some practical tips as well as a few thoughts about VOUS Conference 2019, my most recent "mountaintop" experience. Got questions? Want to know more? Leave a comment and let me know!

title: The Bible Isn't Magical // Real Talk About the Bible
description:
Despite some of our best efforts to make the Bible function like a magic eight ball, the fact is, the Bible isn't magical, and it was never intended to function that way. Moreover, reading the Bible won't magically make you a better person. In this episode of Real Talk About the Bible, we're having a conversation about what the Bible is and isn't in hopes that it builds your faith, grows your love of the Bible, and brings you closer to Jesus. I want to challenge you to adopt a more nuanced view of the Bible that leads you to read the Bible on its own terms, not your terms. I hope this video brings you inspiration and deepens your love for Jesus. Have questions? Disagree? Love it? Let me know down below!

title: Why Christians Shouldn't Feel Guilt
description:
I don't think Christians should feel guilt. I know, that might not fully make sense to you, but hear me out on this one. After all, don't you want this to be true? In this video I'll dive into guilt, where it comes from, why it happens, and how it doesn't fit in the Christian worldview. To be fair, I do believe that conviction still has a large role to play in the lives of Christians, but there is a subtle, yet incredibly important distinction between guilt and conviction. If you'd like to see a full video on that distinction, let me know! Guilt is a hallmark of many people's religious experience, and I hope this video brings you freedom from that and leads you towards your full potential in Jesus. Got questions? Let me know!

title: Yes, But Do You LIKE Jesus?
description:
Often times in Christian circles you'll hear a lot of talk about believing in Jesus, being saved, conversion, asking Jesus into your heart, etc., but somehow it seems we do all of this without asking the seemingly innocuous, but surprisingly important question of, "do you like Jesus?" The problem with avoiding this question is that if we don't like Jesus and his ways, then no amount of "believing in him" is going to help us experience true life transformation. So, if you're struggling in your Christian walk and feel like you're not experiencing the life change that you expected, I'd encourage you to hear me out on this one and see if it applies to you. I hope this video helps you take the next step in your journey of faith and experience true transformation.

title: We're Probably Wrong About God...
description: We're probably wrong about God. There, I said it. Here's the part where you hurl insults at me and tell me I'm wrong (please don't actually feel the need to do this). Often times Christians have very strong feelings that everyone else is wrong about God, the Bible, etc. except for them. You can see it from the pulpit (do churches still have those?) to the comment section of YouTube videos. Perhaps even this one. In this video I challenge you not to consider the truth to be entirely subjective and meaningless, but rather to approach theology with a bit more humility and grace. Remember, we're all in this together. I look forward to hearing your thoughts on this one!

title: What Should We Do with the Weird Stories in the Bible???
description: The truth is, there are some weird stories in the Bible. These are the stories you probably didn't hear preached very much in church because in all fairness to your pastors, they're kind of unsettling. However, this series promised to be real talk about the Bible, and we can't have real talk about the Bible if we neglect the fact that there are some weird stories in there. In this episode I seek to not only bring light to these stories, but also give you some helpful tools on how to approach these stories and try to make sense of them. I hope this video will give you more confidence as you study the Bible, and allow you to maybe reread these stories in a new light.

title: Preachers wearing $1,000 Shoes?  My PreachersNSneakers Hot Take
description: You may have recently heard of an account called "Preachers and Sneakers" highlighting the expensive shoes being worn by high profile evangelical pastors. Pastors like Rich Wilkerson Jr., Chad Veach, Erwin McManus, Judah Smith, John Gray, Steven Furtick, and more have been called out and questioned over their top dollar shoes, sparking lots of conversation on pastors living lives of luxury. In this video I dive into the conversation, sharing my view, and just that, on the topic. Have a different opinion? Awesome! I'd love to hear it.

title: I've Never Read the Bible, Where Should I Start?
description: So, you're new to reading the Bible and don't know where to start? This is just the video for you! The Bible can be a long, confusing and intimidating book, but I hope this video helps you dive into it with confidence.

title: You Can Have Jesus AND a Therapist Too
description:
It's no secret that there's a toxic culture surrounding the issues of mental health, but it's time that Christians lead the charge in saying it's ok to not be ok. 

In this video I jump into the conversation on mental health, specifically in the Christian context, spurred on by a post by The Happy Givers. Do you have thoughts on this issue? Let me know what you think!

title: Reading the Bible Is Hard + Some Quick Bible Study Tips
description:
Hey guys! Welcome to episode one of Real Talk About the Bible, a series where we'll be talking about the weird and wonderful book that we call the Bible. This episode was all about taking the weight off your shoulders and saying what needs to be said, reading the Bible is hard. In addition I offer some tips on how to read the Bible more often and how to understand the Bible better. Tips included picking what translation of the Bible to read, starting Bible studies and reading the Bible with friends, and great resources to help you understand the Bible. 

Resources: 
Videos/Podcast: The Bible Project
Book: How to Read the Bible for All Its Worth

This channel exists to help people grow in their faith by living fully and spreading love, things that can only be done to the full extent when living our lives following Jesus. 

Have questions? Leave a comment down below!

Looking to follow along on social media? Check me out on Instagram at: @austin.suggs

See you soon!

title: Easter 2019 // God's Not Done, He's Only Just Begun // Austin Suggs
description: Easter: the event that changed everything. Happy Easter everyone! I hope you take a second to watch this message in which I unpack the Easter story and challenge you that perhaps the story that you thought was done, has in fact only just begun. In this message I teach through the Easter story, starting in the Garden of Gethsemane, up through the resurrection, and ultimately to where we are today. Easter is the pinnacle event of human history, and in this talk that I gave at FCF Church in their high school environment, I sought to relay the gravity and importance of what Jesus did for us nearly two thousand years ago.

title: Even When You Think You Can't Do It, Push Through It - Austin Suggs
description:
Hey guys! On Sunday, April 14, 2019, I was given the opportunity to speak to the middle and high school students of FCF Church about perseverance, and keeping the promises that we make to ourselves and to God. This message came on the heels of Revive 2019, an annual youth retreat, on which many of the students went and many made significant life decisions regarding their faith journey. My goal was that this message would encourage them to not dwell on their failures that they have experienced and will experience in regards to their commitments they had made as well as calling them to persevere. All the best things in life come on the other side of significant challenges, and this is certainly true in following Jesus. 

Whether you were on Revive 2019 or not, whether you're a student, adult, or not quite sure either category fits you - no matter who you are, I hope this message inspires you live fully, love deeply, and move towards the life that God is calling you to.

title: Where Are You Going Little Sheep? - Austin Suggs at Revive 2019
description:
Hey guys! I'm super excited to share with you all this message that I gave to about 200 high school and middle school students on Revive 2019, a yearly youth retreat put on by FCF Church Student Ministries at Northbay Adventure Camp in North East, Maryland. In this message I challenged the students to consider where they're at, where they're going, and whether or not that will lead them to their intended destination, because, as Andy Stanley says, your direction, not your intention, will determine your destination. Speaking from both Luke 15 and John 6, I hope this message allows you not only to see these passages in a new way, but I hope this message inspires you to take the next step in the direction towards the life that you were created for. 

If you have any questions at all, feel free to comment, or send me a DM on Instagram at @austin.suggs

Huge thanks to FCF Church Student Ministries for inviting me to come and speak. It was such a blessing, and I hope to be able to do it again sometime. 

Until next time, keep spreading love and living fully, propelled by the perfect love of Jesus.

title: Your Expectations Are Robbing You of Peace - Austin Suggs
description:
Hey guys! I'm super excited to share with you all this message from Sunday, March 17th that I gave at FCF Church in their high school ministry. It's all about how our expectations affect our experience, often bringing us stress and robbing us of our peace. We'll look at things like how we can set accurate expectations for our circumstances and people, as well as what Jesus showed us about expectations and peace. I hope you enjoy it, and are able to find more peace is your life. 

Scripture Referenced: 
John 16:33 "I have told you these things so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world." 

Huge thanks to the Velocity Ministry at FCF Church for inviting me to speak.

title: How to Neighbor | Austin Suggs
description:
In week three of a series called Crossroads, I speak on the Good Samaritan, and the idea of "How to Neighbor," a way of living in which we wake up each day and ask the question, "who is in need right in front of me?" 

This message was delivered to a group of High School students in the Velocity ministry at FCF Church.

Credit to where credit is due:
Shirt Illustration was inspired by Carl Lentz and his message in Fresh Life Church's Summer Reading Series.

title: When God Says Go, Don't Say No | Austin Suggs
description: In week one of this series, Crossroads: Life at the Intersection of Go and No, we talk about how on the other side of God's "go" is the life we were always meant for. We discuss how the disciples found themselves at a world-changing crossroads when Jesus gave them the Great Commission in Matthew 28. With an emphasis on international missions, this message was delivered by me (Austin Suggs) to FCF Church's high school students.

title: The Power of Being Present - Let's Chat Ep. 8 with Austin Suggs
description: Life is the sum total of the moments we're fully present in. I find that so many of us are artificially in more moments than ever, but fully present in very few moments. Constantly distracted, we rarely take the time to simply be in the moment, and because of that, we're robbing ourselves of experiencing life as we were meant to. In this video, I talk about the power of being present, in the moment.

title: Stop Asking If Everything is a Sin - Let's Chat Ep. 7 with Austin Suggs
description: Dear Christians, you're asking the wrong question. Everyone likes to ask about all the gray areas in life, wondering what's a sin and what's not. Often times Christians want to get as close to the "sin line" without crossing it. I think this shows that we're missing a key part of what the Christian life is all about. The Christian life is so much more than just avoiding sin, it's about learning to love as Jesus loved.

title: The Art of Stillness - A short film by Austin Suggs
description:
The art of stillness is something that is greatly undervalued in today's society. The ability to slow one's mind, to reflect, dream, and imagine, it is something we all need, and yet our souls are starving for it without us even knowing. If you're looking to maximize your mind, then you must learn to be still. 

Shot in the Frederick Municipal Forest.

title: Got Jesus? Let's Chat Ep. 6 with Austin Suggs
description:
Somewhere along the way we seem to have picked up this idea that God/Jesus was someone to be had for ourselves. We've created a God that we can get on our side to make sure everything goes well for us. In this video, I challenge you that this pocket-sized God that functions as our good luck charm, is a poor representation of the beautiful God that has been revealed in the person of Jesus. If you feel like the version of God you've been presented isn't doing the Divine any justice, then this video is for you. 

This is episode 6 in a series of videos simply titled "Let's Chat." It is my goal that these videos provide a way for you to explore life, faith, and so much more. 

I'm just a guy who is utterly fascinated by Jesus of Nazareth and his message of love for all people. I hope my videos provide you with encouragement to spread love and live fully. 

Video Stuff:
Camera: Canon 80d
Lens: Sigma 18-55 F2.8
Mic: Rode Video Mic Pro

title: An Open Letter to High School Students
description:
High School is a unique time. While some have it easy, navigating the complexities of high school proves difficult for many. On my last day of high school I wrote a letter to my ninth grade self, over a year later I sat down to record it. I won't claim to have figured it all out, but I think inside this letter there are pieces of advice that can help every high school student, and for that matter, people in any time of life. Whether you're facing the horrors of bullying and peer pressure, or you're simply trying to maximize these four years of your life, I think this video is for you. 

Video Equipment:
Main Camera: Canon 80d
Second Camera: Sony a6300
Lenses Used: Sigma 17-55 F2.8 and Sony 35mm F1.8
Microphone: Blue Yeti

Music Credits: Don't Look Back by Jonny Easton

About me: I'm just a guy who is utterly fascinated with Jesus of Nazareth and his teachings of love for all people.

title: Love Your Enemies - Let's Chat Episode 5 with Austin Suggs
description:
Love your enemies. These three words spoken by Jesus in the Sermon on the Mount are perhaps three of the most subversive yet profoundly impactful words he ever spoke. This week I want to challenge you to think about what it might look like for you to truly love your enemies. It's a hard teaching, but it could change everything. Whether you're a Christian, or not sure about all of this, I think you can agree that a world in which we learn to love our enemies is a better world, a world we all want. 

Scripture Referenced: 
Matthew 5

Video Stuff:
Canon 80d
Rode Video Mic Pro
Edited with FCPX

My name is Austin, and I'm just a guy who is utterly fascinated with Jesus of Nazareth and desires to share his message of love and reconciliation to anyone gracious enough to listen.

title: Finding Happiness - Let's Chat Episode 4 with Austin Suggs
description:
With so many people pursuing happiness, you think we'd be a little better at finding it. I'm not going to claim to have the "secret" to happiness, but I do think these are steps in the right direction. 

Video Stuff:
Camera: Canon 80D
Lens: Sigma 17-50mm F2.8
Mic: Blue Yeti
Edited in FCPX

More about me: 
I'm just a guy utterly fascinated by Jesus of Nazareth and his teachings on loving others. I believe in a brighter tomorrow and seek to inspire people to live fuller lives that make the world better.

Find me on Instagram at: 
www.instagram.com/austin.suggs

title: The Story You're Living - Let's Chat: Episode 3 by Austin Suggs
description:
Each day the story of our lives is being written, but are you writing it, or is it being written for you? Our life is our story and our story is our life, and if we are to live a story worth reading, we must write with intention. 

What does it take to lead a life your proud of? In this video I dive into the ideas of what your life would look like, read as a story when it's all said and done, with each day acting as a page, and seasons of our life acting as chapters, all creating the plot and arc of our life story. 

Video Stuff:
Camera: Canon 80D
Lens: Sigma 17-50mm F2.8
Mic: Blue Yeti
Edited in FCPX

More about me: 
I'm just a guy utterly fascinated by Jesus of Nazareth and his teachings on loving others. I believe in a brighter tomorrow and seek to inspire people to live fuller lives that make the world better.

Find me on Instagram at: 
www.instagram.com/austin.suggs

title: Invisible People - Let's Chat: Episode 2 by Austin Suggs
description:
How many people are you crossing paths with, but not really seeing? I'm convinced that love is the way forward. That love is the source of a brighter tomorrow, a love for everyone, always. But to love someone, we must first see them.

Video Stuff:
Camera: Canon 80D
Lens: Sigma 17-50mm F2.8
Mic: Blue Yeti
Edited in FCPX

More about me: 
I'm just a guy utterly fascinated by Jesus of Nazareth and his teachings on loving others. I believe in a brighter tomorrow and seek to inspire people to live fuller lives that make the world better.

Find me on Instagram at: 
www.instagram.com/austin.suggs

title: Forgetting Realism - Let's Chat: Episode 1 by Austin Suggs
description:
Too often we settle for mediocrity in the name of realism. There's a deeper life for us where we can tap into all the potential that I believe is inside all of us. If you're looking for motivation for success, motivation for living your best life, and much more, the first thing to do is forget realism and dare to dream.

Video Stuff:
Camera: Canon 80D
Lens: Sigma 17-50mm F2.8
Mic: Blue Yeti
Edited in FCPX

More about me: 
I'm just a guy utterly fascinated by Jesus of Nazareth and his teachings on loving others. I believe in a brighter tomorrow and seek to inspire people to live fuller lives that make the world better.
